channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Paris.pm monthly meeting
item.description: September 10, 2025
item.dc:subject: Events

item.title: Paris.pm monthly meeting
item.description: August 13, 2025
item.dc:subject: Events

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Great CPAN modules released last week.
item.dc:subject: Weekly collections

item.title: Not a Nice Problem to Have
item.description: An insightful, advanced and enjoyable read—ideal for those who appreciate both performance-aware coding and elegant problem-solving.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Y Translate?
item.description: A clean, polished walkthrough demonstrating idiomatic solutions with attention to detail—particularly in normalization and edge-case handling. Well written and focused, with practical depth.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Endings, Elephants and Explanations
item.description: This blog post is a thoughtful and engaging walk through of Raku solutions to the challenge, woven with personal reflection and a touch of humor. It opens with a heartfelt tribute to the late MST,
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Nice Counter
item.description: It offers a clear, practical walkthrough of the weekly challenge in both Perl and Rust, showing straightforward and idiomatic solutions for each.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Fun with strings
item.description: The post does a great job of highlighting ambiguities in specifications. It identifies potential edge cases (a9a09a) and makes reasonable assumptions while also pointing out how easily such details can be overlooked or underspecified.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: It MUST be nice!
item.description: The post delivers solid, multi-language solutions to two algorithmic tasks—extracting distinct integers from mixed strings and identifying the longest "nice" substring—with clear thought processes and thorough commentary. The musical theater references and clever title pun, helps make technical content more approachable.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Counter-Nice
item.description: The post balances clarity, correctness and Perl expertise. A great read for anyone interested in clean problem-solving and Perl-specific insights.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 329
item.description: The post provides elegant and efficient solutions to the tasks, demonstrating a deep understanding of Perl's capabilities. The reflective analysis adds valuable insights into the complexities of problem-solving in programming.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: mangling strings
item.description: Raku solutions are idiomatic and concise, leveraging regex and built-ins elegantly. An outstanding, well-organized exploration of polyglot programming applied to algorithmic problem solving.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Nice Integers
item.description: The use of uniqint over a simple digit-matching regex is clean and effective—an elegant one-liner that does exactly what's needed without overcomplication.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 329
item.description: Solutions leaned toward succinct, readable Perl and Raku idioms. The variety of strategies—regex, loops, data structures—showing the languages’ flexibility.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Counter Nice
item.description: The post tackles both parts of the challenge with thoughtful code and helpful inline commentary. It's Well-documented, beginner-friendly and a good demonstration of Raku’s expressiveness.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: TWC329
item.description: The solutions are crisp, Perlish, and demonstrate a good grasp of regular expressions and bitwise logic.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Let’s Count All of Our Nice Strings
item.description: A creative and playful dive into string processing in Perl. The code is modular, well-commented, and structured using Literate Programming style fragments.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 329
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Counter Integers" and "Nice String" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 330
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Clear Digits" and "Title Capital". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.
item.dc:subject: The Weekly Challenge

item.title: A pipe operator exists on perl v5.42?
item.dc:subject: Articles

item.title: Support Gabor
item.description: I started the Perl Weekly newsletter 14 years ago and (the precursor of) the Perl Maven site 20 years ago. Recently I started to write a booklet about OOP in Perl. I love providing consulting, development, and training services to companies, but I still prefer creating free content. I could do more of the latter if you also supported me. There are several ways to do that. You can do it via Patreon, GitHub, PayPal, or by buying one of my books.
item.dc:subject: Sponsors

item.title: #729 - Videos from TPRC
item.description:
Hi there!

The Perl and Raku Conference was held 2 weeks ago, videos are being uploaded to YouTube

Sad news: Mark Keating posted that Matt S. Trout (mst) passed away. Mark also collected the comments and publications of others.

Podcast: MetaCPAN - Underbar episode 3

Enjoy your week!
item.dc:subject: Editorial
